depth_step.desc: The slant depth of each step in the shower propagation

time_bin.desc: The size of the time bins for the photons collected

fluor_thin.desc: The rate of computational thinning for fluorescence photons

ckv_thin.desc: The rate of computational thinning for Cherenkov photons

ground_normal.desc: A unit vector normal to the ground plane

ground_point.desc: A point on the ground plane

elevation_angle.desc: The angle of the detector axis with respect to the horizon

energy_pow.desc: The exponent in the negative power law of the energy distribution

e_min.desc: The minimum shower energy to simulate

e_max.desc: The maximum shower energy to simulate

impact_min.desc: The minimum impact parameter to simulate

impact_max.desc: The maximum impact parameter to simulate

first_interact.desc: The parameter x_0 in the GH profile (note that this may be negative)

start_tracking.desc: The depth where the simulation begins tracking the shower (this must be positive to make any physical sense)

n_max_ratio.desc: The constant used to determine the size of the shower at maximum from the primary energy

rho_sea.desc: The density of the atmosphere at sea level in

atmosphere_temp.desc: The constant temperature of the exponential atmosphere

refrac_sea.desc: The index of refraction of air at sea level, proportional to the local atmospheric density

refrac_lens.desc: The index of refraction for the corrector plate

mirror_radius.desc: The radius of curvature of the detector mirror

cluster_diameter.desc: The diameter of the photomultiplier array

n_pmt_across.desc: The width/height of the photomultiplier grid in number of photomultipliers (should be even)

gh_lambda.desc: The lambda parameter in the GH distribution

fluor_a1.desc: A parameter in the expression for fluorescence yield from Kakimoto

fluor_a2.desc: A parameter in the expression for fluorescence yield from Kakimoto

fluor_b1.desc: A parameter in the expression for fluorescence yield from Kakimoto

fluor_b2.desc: A parameter in the expression for fluorescence yield from Kakimoto

dep_1_4.desc: The energy deposit rate of a single electron with energy 1.4 MeV

ion_c1.desc: A parameter in the expression for the effective ionization loss rate

ion_c2.desc: A parameter in the expression for the effective ionization loss rate

ion_c3.desc: A parameter in the expression for the effective ionization loss rate (unitless)

ion_c4.desc: A parameter in the expression for the effective ionization loss rate (unitless)

ion_c5.desc: A parameter in the expression for the effective ionization loss rate (unitless)

ckv_k1.desc: The leading constant for theta_c in the Cherenkov angular distribution (Stratton 4.17)

ckv_k2.desc: The constant in the exponent for theta_c in the Cherenkov angular distrubution (Stratton 4.17)

lambda_min.desc: The minimum wavelength of Cherenkov photons being considered

lambda_max.desc: The maximum wavelength of Cherenkov photons being considered

fe_a11.desc: A parameter in the expression for the electron energy spectrum (Nerling Eq 18-21)

fe_a12.desc: A parameter in the expression for the electron energy spectrum (Nerling Eq 18-21)

fe_a21.desc: A parameter in the expression for the electron energy spectrum (Nerling Eq 18-21)

fe_a22.desc: A parameter in the expression for the electron energy spectrum (Nerling Eq 18-21)

fe_k0.desc: A parameter used to calculate the normalization constant in the electron spectrum (Nerling Eq 20)

fe_k1.desc: A parameter used to calculate the normalization constant in the electron spectrum (Nerling Eq 20)

fe_k2.desc: A parameter used to calculate the normalization constant in the electron spectrum (Nerling Eq 20)

sky_noise.desc: Average number of noise photons above horizon

ground_noise.desc: Average number of noise photons below horizon

x_max_1.desc: The first term in the expression for the depth of the shower maximum

x_max_2.desc: The value multiplying the second term in the expression for depth at maximum

x_max_3.desc: The value following log(E) in the expression for depth at maximum

trigger_thresh.desc: The number of standard deviations required for a pixel to contribute to triggering

hold_thresh.desc: The number of standard deviations required for a pixel to not be thrown out

trigger_clust.desc: The number of connected, triggered tubes required for a frame to be triggered

mirror_reflect.desc: The fraction of incident photons which are reflected from the mirror

filter_transmit.desc: The fraction of incident photons which are transmitted through the filter

quantum_eff.desc: The fraction of photons incident on a photomultiplier which result in a signal
